history.text: Hi there - have you seen the movie How to Train Your Dragon before?
No I haven't, what is about?
It is an animation fantasy movie that is based on a British Book series with the same title. It is a coming of age tale about friendship between a boy and his animal.
Is it live action or animated?
It is animated.
Anyone famous doing the voices?
The voice actor are Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Craig Ferguson, America Ferrera, Jonah Hill, TJ Miller, Kristen Wiig, and Chris Mintz-Plasse.
actors*
I really like Craig Ferguson, sounds interesting
What rating is it?
It has gotten great reviews, especially for its animation skills and comedy. If you are looking for a movie it may be worth a watch. Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 98% rating
It does sound promising, do you know what studio made it?
Pixar studios made the film. Do you typically watch animated films?
Actually I misread that. I'm not sure who made the film but it is compared to the level of Pixar in the reviews.
Oh OK. I do like the Pixar stuff a lot
Looks like DreamWorks produced How to Train Your Dragon - do you also like movies from that studio?
I can't recall any DreamWorks movies by name, but yes I like some of their stuff
What year was it made?
It was made in 2010. Some of the key scenes from the movie involve interactions between a 15yo kid from a Viking Village and a dragon he finds in the forest after mistakenly thinking he shot it down.
I do like Dragons and I like fantasy movies as well
This movie seems like it might be a good match for you!
Yes it does sound like it could be fun to watch
Do you enjoy action films as well? This movie has some animated battle scenes
I really liked the Lord of the Rings movies, plenty of battles in those
There's a scene in which the dragon, Toothless, ends up battling an entire Dragon's Nest - I think you might enjoy it
Is the dragon named "Toothless"?
Yes the dragon is named Toothless.
I assume it does actually have teeth
The name was given by the 15yo boy (named Hiccup) because the dragon can retract his teeth
Cool... seems like the movie has some humor in it too then
Yes some of the reviews mention the comedy portions as well. Think you will consider watching this movie
Thanks for all the info, you've been very helpful

uid2response.feedback: I'm not really too much of a fan of animated movies to be honest, so that is the biggest deciding factor for me
